segment.source: The APIs in the Windows.Media.Editing namespace allow you to quickly develop apps that enable the users to create media compositions from audio and video source files.
segment.target: The APIs in the Windows.Media.Editing namespace allow you to quickly develop apps that enable the users to create media compositions from audio and video source files.

segment.source: Media compositions and editing
segment.target: Media compositions and editing

segment.source: Media compositions and editing
segment.target: Media compositions and editing

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article shows you how to use the APIs in the Windows.Media.Editing namespace to quickly develop apps that enable the users to create media compositions from audio and video source files.
segment.target: This article shows you how to use the APIs in the Windows.Media.Editing namespace to quickly develop apps that enable the users to create media compositions from audio and video source files.

segment.source: Features of the framework include the ability to programmatically append multiple video clips together, add video and image overlays, add background audio, and apply both audio and video effects.
segment.target: Features of the framework include the ability to programmatically append multiple video clips together, add video and image overlays, add background audio, and apply both audio and video effects.

segment.source: Once created, media compositions can be rendered into a flat media file for playback or sharing, but compositions can also be serialized to and deserialized from disk, allowing the user to load and modify compositions that they have previously created.
segment.target: Once created, media compositions can be rendered into a flat media file for playback or sharing, but compositions can also be serialized to and deserialized from disk, allowing the user to load and modify compositions that they have previously created.

segment.source: All of this functionality is provided in an easy-to-use Windows Runtime interface that dramatically reduces the amount and complexity of code required to perform these tasks when compared to the low-level Microsoft Media Foundation API.
segment.target: All of this functionality is provided in an easy-to-use Windows Runtime interface that dramatically reduces the amount and complexity of code required to perform these tasks when compared to the low-level Microsoft Media Foundation API.

segment.source: Create a new media composition
segment.target: Create a new media composition

segment.source: The MediaComposition class is the container for all of the media clips that make up the composition and is responsible for rendering the final composition, loading and saving compositions to disc, and providing a preview stream of the composition so that the user can view it in the UI.
segment.target: The MediaComposition class is the container for all of the media clips that make up the composition and is responsible for rendering the final composition, loading and saving compositions to disc, and providing a preview stream of the composition so that the user can view it in the UI.

segment.source: To use MediaComposition in your app, include the Windows.Media.Editing namespace as well as the Windows.Media.Core namespace that provides related APIs that you will need.
segment.target: To use MediaComposition in your app, include the Windows.Media.Editing namespace as well as the Windows.Media.Core namespace that provides related APIs that you will need.

segment.source: Namespace1
segment.target: Namespace1

segment.source: The MediaComposition object will be accessed from multiple points in your code, so typically you will declare a member variable in which to store it.
segment.target: The MediaComposition object will be accessed from multiple points in your code, so typically you will declare a member variable in which to store it.

segment.source: DeclareMediaComposition
segment.target: DeclareMediaComposition

segment.source: The constructor for MediaComposition takes no arguments.
segment.target: The constructor for MediaComposition takes no arguments.

segment.source: MediaCompositionConstructor
segment.target: MediaCompositionConstructor

segment.source: Add media clips to a composition
segment.target: Add media clips to a composition

segment.source: Media compositions typically contain one or more video clips.
segment.target: Media compositions typically contain one or more video clips.

segment.source: You can use a FileOpenPicker to allow the user to select a video file.
segment.target: You can use a FileOpenPicker to allow the user to select a video file.

segment.source: Once the file has been selected, create a new MediaClip object to contain the video clip by calling MediaClip.CreateFromFileAsync.
segment.target: Once the file has been selected, create a new MediaClip object to contain the video clip by calling MediaClip.CreateFromFileAsync.

segment.source: Then you add the clip to the MediaComposition object's Clips list.
segment.target: Then you add the clip to the MediaComposition object's Clips list.

segment.source: PickFileAndAddClip
segment.target: PickFileAndAddClip

segment.source: Media clips appear in the MediaComposition in the same order as they appear in Clips list.
segment.target: Media clips appear in the MediaComposition in the same order as they appear in Clips list.

segment.source: A MediaClip can only be included in a composition once.
segment.target: A MediaClip can only be included in a composition once.

segment.source: Attempting to add a MediaClip that is already being used by the composition will result in an error.
segment.target: Attempting to add a MediaClip that is already being used by the composition will result in an error.

segment.source: To reuse a video clip multiple times in a composition, call Clone to create new MediaClip objects which can then be added to the composition.
segment.target: To reuse a video clip multiple times in a composition, call Clone to create new MediaClip objects which can then be added to the composition.

segment.source: Universal Windows apps do not have permission to access the entire file system.
segment.target: Universal Windows apps do not have permission to access the entire file system.

segment.source: The FutureAccessList property of the StorageApplicationPermissions class allows your app to store a record of a file that has been selected by the user so that you can retain permissions to access the file.
segment.target: The FutureAccessList property of the StorageApplicationPermissions class allows your app to store a record of a file that has been selected by the user so that you can retain permissions to access the file.

segment.source: The FutureAccessList has a maxium of 1000 entries, so your app needs to manage the list to make sure it does not become full.
segment.target: The FutureAccessList has a maxium of 1000 entries, so your app needs to manage the list to make sure it does not become full.

segment.source: This is especially important if you plan to support loading and modifying previously created compositions.
segment.target: This is especially important if you plan to support loading and modifying previously created compositions.

segment.source: A MediaComposition supports video clips in MP4 format.
segment.target: A MediaComposition supports video clips in MP4 format.

segment.source: If a video file contains multiple embedded audio tracks, you can select which audio track is used in the composition by setting the SelectedEmbeddedAudioTrackIndex property.
segment.target: If a video file contains multiple embedded audio tracks, you can select which audio track is used in the composition by setting the SelectedEmbeddedAudioTrackIndex property.

segment.source: Create a MediaClip with a single color filling the entire frame by calling CreateFromColor and specifying a color and a duration for the clip.
segment.target: Create a MediaClip with a single color filling the entire frame by calling CreateFromColor and specifying a color and a duration for the clip.

segment.source: Create a MediaClip from an image file by calling CreateFromImageFileAsync and specifying an image file and a duration for the clip.
segment.target: Create a MediaClip from an image file by calling CreateFromImageFileAsync and specifying an image file and a duration for the clip.

segment.source: Create a MediaClip from a IDirect3DSurface by calling CreateFromSurface and specifying a surface and a duration from the clip.
segment.target: Create a MediaClip from a IDirect3DSurface by calling CreateFromSurface and specifying a surface and a duration from the clip.

segment.source: Preview the composition in a MediaElement
segment.target: Preview the composition in a MediaElement

segment.source: To enable the user to view the media composition, add a MediaElement to the XAML file that defines your UI.
segment.target: To enable the user to view the media composition, add a MediaElement to the XAML file that defines your UI.

segment.source: MediaElement
segment.target: MediaElement

segment.source: Declare a member variable of type MediaStreamSource.
segment.target: Declare a member variable of type MediaStreamSource.

segment.source: DeclareMediaStreamSource
segment.target: DeclareMediaStreamSource

segment.source: Call the MediaComposition object's GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource method to create a MediaStreamSource for the composition and then call the SetMediaStreamSource method of the MediaElement.
segment.target: Call the MediaComposition object's GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource method to create a MediaStreamSource for the composition and then call the SetMediaStreamSource method of the MediaElement.

segment.source: Now the composition can be viewed in the UI.
segment.target: Now the composition can be viewed in the UI.

segment.source: UpdateMediaElementSource
segment.target: UpdateMediaElementSource

segment.source: The MediaComposition must contain at least one media clip before calling GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource, or the returned object will be null.
segment.target: The MediaComposition must contain at least one media clip before calling GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource, or the returned object will be null.

segment.source: The MediaElement timeline is not automatically updated to reflect changes in the composition.
segment.target: The MediaElement timeline is not automatically updated to reflect changes in the composition.

segment.source: It is recommended that you call both GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource and SetMediaStreamSource every time you make a set of changes to the composition and want to update the UI.
segment.target: It is recommended that you call both GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource and SetMediaStreamSource every time you make a set of changes to the composition and want to update the UI.

segment.source: It is recommended that you set the MediaStreamSource object and the Source property of the MediaElement to null when the user navigates away from the page in order to release associated resources.
segment.target: It is recommended that you set the MediaStreamSource object and the Source property of the MediaElement to null when the user navigates away from the page in order to release associated resources.

segment.source: OnNavigatedFrom
segment.target: OnNavigatedFrom

segment.source: Render the composition to a video file
segment.target: Render the composition to a video file

segment.source: To render a media composition to a flat video file so that it can be shared and viewed on other devices, you will need to use APIs from the Windows.Media.Transcoding namespace.
segment.target: To render a media composition to a flat video file so that it can be shared and viewed on other devices, you will need to use APIs from the Windows.Media.Transcoding namespace.

segment.source: To update the UI on the progress of the async operation, you will also need APIs from the Windows.UI.Core namespace.
segment.target: To update the UI on the progress of the async operation, you will also need APIs from the Windows.UI.Core namespace.

segment.source: Namespace2
segment.target: Namespace2

segment.source: After allowing the user to select an output file with a FileSavePicker, render the composition to the selected file by calling the MediaComposition object's RenderToFileAsync.
segment.target: After allowing the user to select an output file with a FileSavePicker, render the composition to the selected file by calling the MediaComposition object's RenderToFileAsync.

segment.source: The rest of the code in the following example simply follows the pattern of handling an AsyncOperationWithProgress.
segment.target: The rest of the code in the following example simply follows the pattern of handling an AsyncOperationWithProgress.

segment.source: RenderCompositionToFile
segment.target: RenderCompositionToFile

segment.source: The MediaTrimmingPreference allows you to prioritize speed of the transcoding operation versus the precision of trimming of adjacent media clips.
segment.target: The MediaTrimmingPreference allows you to prioritize speed of the transcoding operation versus the precision of trimming of adjacent media clips.

segment.source: Fast causes transcoding to be faster with lower-precision trimming, Precise causes transcoding to be slower but with more precise trimming.
segment.target: Fast causes transcoding to be faster with lower-precision trimming, Precise causes transcoding to be slower but with more precise trimming.

segment.source: Trim a video clip
segment.target: Trim a video clip

segment.source: Trim the duration of a video clip in a composition by setting the MediaClip objects TrimTimeFromStart property, the TrimTimeFromEnd property, or both.
segment.target: Trim the duration of a video clip in a composition by setting the MediaClip objects TrimTimeFromStart property, the TrimTimeFromEnd property, or both.

segment.source: TrimClipBeforeCurrentPosition
segment.target: TrimClipBeforeCurrentPosition

segment.source: Your can use any UI that you want to let the user specify the start and end trim values.
segment.target: Your can use any UI that you want to let the user specify the start and end trim values.

segment.source: The example above uses the Position property of the MediaElement to first determine which MediaClip is playing back at the current position in the composition by checking the StartTimeInComposition and EndTimeInComposition.
segment.target: The example above uses the Position property of the MediaElement to first determine which MediaClip is playing back at the current position in the composition by checking the StartTimeInComposition and EndTimeInComposition.

segment.source: Then the Position and StartTimeInComposition properties are used again to calculate the amount of time to trim from the beginning of the clip.
segment.target: Then the Position and StartTimeInComposition properties are used again to calculate the amount of time to trim from the beginning of the clip.

segment.source: The FirstOrDefault method is an extension method from the System.Linq namespace that simplifies the code for selecting items from a list.
segment.target: The FirstOrDefault method is an extension method from the System.Linq namespace that simplifies the code for selecting items from a list.

segment.source: The OriginalDuration property of the MediaClip object lets you know the duration of the media clip without any clipping applied.
segment.target: The OriginalDuration property of the MediaClip object lets you know the duration of the media clip without any clipping applied.

segment.source: The TrimmedDuration property lets you know the duration of the media clip after trimming is applied.
segment.target: The TrimmedDuration property lets you know the duration of the media clip after trimming is applied.

segment.source: Specifying a trimming value that is larger than the original duration of the clip does not throw an error.
segment.target: Specifying a trimming value that is larger than the original duration of the clip does not throw an error.

segment.source: However, if a composition contains only a single clip and that is trimmed to zero length by specifying a large trimming value, a subsequent call to GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource will return null, as if the composition has no clips.
segment.target: However, if a composition contains only a single clip and that is trimmed to zero length by specifying a large trimming value, a subsequent call to GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource will return null, as if the composition has no clips.

segment.source: Add a background audio track to a composition
segment.target: Add a background audio track to a composition

segment.source: To add a background track to a composition, load an audio file and then create a BackgroundAudioTrack object by calling the factory method BackgroundAudioTrack.CreateFromFileAsync.
segment.target: To add a background track to a composition, load an audio file and then create a BackgroundAudioTrack object by calling the factory method BackgroundAudioTrack.CreateFromFileAsync.

segment.source: Then, add the BackgroundAudioTrack to the composition's BackgroundAudioTracks property.
segment.target: Then, add the BackgroundAudioTrack to the composition's BackgroundAudioTracks property.

segment.source: AddBackgroundAudioTrack
segment.target: AddBackgroundAudioTrack

segment.source: A MediaComposition supports background audio tracks in the following formats: MP3, WAV, FLAC
segment.target: A MediaComposition supports background audio tracks in the following formats: MP3, WAV, FLAC

segment.source: A background audio track
segment.target: A background audio track

segment.source: As with video files, you should use the StorageApplicationPermissions class to preserve access to files in the composition.
segment.target: As with video files, you should use the StorageApplicationPermissions class to preserve access to files in the composition.

segment.source: As with MediaClip, a BackgroundAudioTrack can only be included in a composition once.
segment.target: As with MediaClip, a BackgroundAudioTrack can only be included in a composition once.

segment.source: Attempting to add a BackgroundAudioTrack that is already being used by the composition will result in an error.
segment.target: Attempting to add a BackgroundAudioTrack that is already being used by the composition will result in an error.

segment.source: To reuse an audio track multiple times in a composition, call Clone to create new MediaClip objects which can then be added to the composition.
segment.target: To reuse an audio track multiple times in a composition, call Clone to create new MediaClip objects which can then be added to the composition.

segment.source: By default, background audio tracks begin playing at the start of the composition.
segment.target: By default, background audio tracks begin playing at the start of the composition.

segment.source: If multiple background tracks are present, all of the tracks will begin playing at the start of the composition.
segment.target: If multiple background tracks are present, all of the tracks will begin playing at the start of the composition.

segment.source: To cause a background audio track to be begin playback at another time, set the Delay property to the desired time offset.
segment.target: To cause a background audio track to be begin playback at another time, set the Delay property to the desired time offset.

segment.source: Add an overlay to a composition
segment.target: Add an overlay to a composition

segment.source: Overlays allow you to stack multiple layers of video on top of each other in a composition.
segment.target: Overlays allow you to stack multiple layers of video on top of each other in a composition.

segment.source: A composition can contain multiple overlay layers, each of which can include multiple overlays.
segment.target: A composition can contain multiple overlay layers, each of which can include multiple overlays.

segment.source: Create a MediaOverlay object by passing a MediaClip into its constructor.
segment.target: Create a MediaOverlay object by passing a MediaClip into its constructor.

segment.source: Set the position and opacity of the overlay, then create a new MediaOverlayLayer and add the MediaOverlay to its Overlays list.
segment.target: Set the position and opacity of the overlay, then create a new MediaOverlayLayer and add the MediaOverlay to its Overlays list.

segment.source: Finally, add the MediaOverlayLayer to the composition's OverlayLayers list.
segment.target: Finally, add the MediaOverlayLayer to the composition's OverlayLayers list.

segment.source: AddOverlay
segment.target: AddOverlay

segment.source: Overlays within a layer are z-ordered based on their order in their containing layer's Overlays list.
segment.target: Overlays within a layer are z-ordered based on their order in their containing layer's Overlays list.

segment.source: Higher indices within the list are rendered on top of lower indices.
segment.target: Higher indices within the list are rendered on top of lower indices.

segment.source: The same is true of overlay layers within a composition.
segment.target: The same is true of overlay layers within a composition.

segment.source: A layer with higher index in the composition's OverlayLayers list will be rendered on top of lower indices.
segment.target: A layer with higher index in the composition's OverlayLayers list will be rendered on top of lower indices.

segment.source: Because overlays are stacked on top of each other instead of being played sequentially, all overlays start playback at the beginning of the composition by default.
segment.target: Because overlays are stacked on top of each other instead of being played sequentially, all overlays start playback at the beginning of the composition by default.

segment.source: To cause an overlay to be begin playback at another time, set the Delay property to the desired time offset.
segment.target: To cause an overlay to be begin playback at another time, set the Delay property to the desired time offset.

segment.source: Add effects to a media clip
segment.target: Add effects to a media clip

segment.source: Each MediaClip in a composition has a list of audio and video effects to which multiple effects can be added.
segment.target: Each MediaClip in a composition has a list of audio and video effects to which multiple effects can be added.

segment.source: The effects must implement IAudioEffectDefinition and IVideoEffectDefinition respectively.
segment.target: The effects must implement IAudioEffectDefinition and IVideoEffectDefinition respectively.

segment.source: The following example uses the current media element position to choose the currently viewed MediaClip and then creates a new instance of the VideoStabilizationEffectDefinition and appends it to the media clip's VideoEffectDefinitions list.
segment.target: The following example uses the current media element position to choose the currently viewed MediaClip and then creates a new instance of the VideoStabilizationEffectDefinition and appends it to the media clip's VideoEffectDefinitions list.

segment.source: AddVideoEffect
segment.target: AddVideoEffect

segment.source: Save a composition to a file
segment.target: Save a composition to a file

segment.source: Media compositions can be serialized to a file to be modified at a later time.
segment.target: Media compositions can be serialized to a file to be modified at a later time.

segment.source: Pick an output file and then call the MediaComposition method SaveAsync to save the composition.
segment.target: Pick an output file and then call the MediaComposition method SaveAsync to save the composition.

segment.source: SaveComposition
segment.target: SaveComposition

segment.source: Load a composition from a file
segment.target: Load a composition from a file

segment.source: Media compositions can be deserialized from a file to allow the user to view and modify the composition.
segment.target: Media compositions can be deserialized from a file to allow the user to view and modify the composition.

segment.source: Pick a composition file and then call the MediaComposition method LoadAsync to load the composition.
segment.target: Pick a composition file and then call the MediaComposition method LoadAsync to load the composition.

segment.source: OpenComposition
segment.target: OpenComposition

segment.source: If a media file in the composition is not in a location that can be accessed by your app and is not in the FutureAccessList property of the StorageApplicationPermissions class for your app, an error will be thrown when loading the composition.
segment.target: If a media file in the composition is not in a location that can be accessed by your app and is not in the FutureAccessList property of the StorageApplicationPermissions class for your app, an error will be thrown when loading the composition.
